com.esri.mo2.ui.bean
Class Layer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Container
              |
              +--javax.swing.JComponent
                    |
                    +--com.esri.mo2.ui.bean.Layer
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable
public class Layer
extends JComponent

This component can be added to a Map bean in an IDE at design time. It provides a convenient way to add a layer dataset at design time. It can also be used at run time to add a layer to the map bean. In that case, the setDataset(String details) method should be used to specify the dataset path. For examples of how to do this, see the samples in the tutorial application.

See Also:
Serialized Form

getLayerHandlers

public static Iterator getLayerHandlers()
Obtains an Iterator over the currently available layer handlers. This Iterator will be read-only. You can cast each Object returned by the Iterator's next() method to a LayerHandler.

getRendererHandlers

public static Iterator getRendererHandlers()
Obtains an Iterator over the currently available renderer handlers. This Iterator will be read-only. You can cast each Object returned by the Iterator's next() to a RendererHandler.

getDataset

public String getDataset()
Obtains the Dataset details. This is normally managed by the DatasetEditor.

setDataset

public void setDataset(String details)
Sets the dataset string for the layer. A dataset string is normally set using the DatasetEditor during design-time within an IDE. It contains information needed to create a map layer at run-time.

Parameters:
details - - defines where the layer will get data:

  • To get file based data (shape, image, SDC, VPF):
    "com.esri.mo2.src.file.FileSystemConnection!<absolute_file_path>!"
    For example:
    "com.esri.mo2.src.file.FileSystemConnection!C:/ESRI/ESRIDATA/USA/states.shp!"
    "com.esri.mo2.src.file.FileSystemConnection!C:/ESRI/ESRIDATA/Washington/Wash.jpg!"
    "com.esri.mo2.src.file.FileSystemConnection!C:/ESRI/MOJ20/Samples/Data/SDCData/states.sdc!"
    "com.esri.mo2.src.file.FileSystemConnection!T:/Data/vpf_rpf_data/EURNASIA2/rference:dbref:dbref!"

  • Content paths for CAD files are similar to those for other file based data sources, but must include the feature type at the end.
    For example:
    "com.esri.mo2.src.file.FileSystemConnection!C:/MOJ20_final/MOJ20/Samples/Data/CADdata/buildings.dxf/Polyline!"

  • Content paths for VPF and RPF files are also similar to those for other file based data sources, but must include the name of the layer at the end.
    For example:
    "com.esri.mo2.src.file.FileSystemConnection!E:Data/vpf_rpf_data/EURONASIA2/v068_001:elev:elevp!"
  • To get data from ArcSDE:
    "com.esri.mo2.client.sde.SdeConnection!<Layer_Name>!<Server>:<Instance>:[option_database]:<user>:<password>"
     For example:
    "com.esri.mo2.client.sde.SdeConnection!/BOLIVIA.CITIES/Point!entropy:5151: :bolivia:bolivia"

  • To get data from ArcIMS:
    "com.esri.mo2.client.aims.ArcIms4Connection!<ServiceName/LayerName>!<URL>"
    Example one: To access an image layer from an image service (the service and layer have the same name for an ArcIMS image service) :
    "com.esri.mo2.client.aims.ArcIms4Connection!/ESRI_Land/ESRI_Land!http://www.geographynetwork.com/servlet/com.esri.esrimap.Esrimap"
    Example two: To access a feature layer from a feature service :
    "com.esri.mo2.client.aims.ArcIms4Connection!/Census_Population_FS/County Boundaries!http://www.geographynetwork.com/servlet/com.esri.esrimap.Esrimap"

Note: the format of the dataset string is different from the one in MO Java version 1. This is partially due to the new Content API in the com.esri.mo2.ui.cat and com.esri.mo2.src.sys packages. These packages allow the developer to dynamically add support for custom data sources.
However, the Layer bean still supports the old dataset string format:
  • To get a shapefile: "0;<shape file path>"
  • To get an image file: "1;<image file path>"
  • To get a layer from an ArcIMS server: "2;<URL>;<SERVICE>;<SERVICE-TYPE>;<LAYER>;<TYPE>"
  • To get a layer from an ArcSDE server: "3;<HOST>;<PORT>;[DATABASE];<USER>;<PASSWORD>;<LAYER>;<TYPE>"

getLayer

public Layer getLayer()
               throws Exception
Gets the underlying map Layer that can be added to a Map

Returns:
the map Layer, or null if the Dataset has not yet been set
Throws:
IOException - if any problems occur while connecting with the data source.
Exception

setRendererDetails

public void setRendererDetails(String newRendererDetails)
A simple way to create a Renderer object. This method is usually called during design-time by an IDE. The newRendererDetails string gets parsed into a simple Renderer object for use by the layer.

Parameters:
newRendererDetails - a String in the format: "0;red;green;blue"; e.g."0;125;125;125"

getRendererDetails

public String getRendererDetails()
Returns the string used to represent a simple Renderer object.

Returns:
a String in the format "0;red;green;blue".
